api_overview.title: Placeholder API Documentation (v1)
api_overview.description: This documentation outlines the structure and usage of the Example Service API. Since no backend analysis data was provided, the following documentation uses standard best practices and common resource examples (Users) to illustrate the required structure and quality.
authentication_methods: JWT Bearer Token (Required for most endpoints)

general_information.rate_limiting: Standard rate limits apply (e.g., 100 requests per minute per IP).
general_information.data_format: All requests and responses use JSON (application/json).

authentication_authorization.how_to_authenticate: After successful login (via a hypothetical `/auth/login` endpoint), the server returns a JWT. This token must be included in the Authorization header of all protected requests.
authentication_authorization.token_format: The token is a standard Base64-encoded JWT.
authentication_authorization.authorization_scopes: Authorization is handled via roles embedded in the JWT payload (e.g., 'user', 'admin'). Endpoints requiring elevated privileges will return a 403 Forbidden error if the token lacks the necessary scope.

User.description: Represents a registered user in the system.

is_active.description: Indicates if the user account is currently active.

NewUser.description: Schema for creating a new user.

ErrorResponse.description: Standard structure for API error responses.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

endpoints_documentation.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all registered users.

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of users to return.

query.name: offset
query.description: The starting index for the list.

error_responses.description: Bad Request (Validation error, e.g., missing required fields or invalid email format).
Conflict (User with that email or username already exists).

standard_errors.description: The request was invalid, often due to missing required parameters or failed validation checks. Details are provided in the response body's 'message' field.
Authentication failed. The request lacks valid credentials (e.g., missing or expired JWT).
The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it. The authenticated user does not have the necessary permissions (scope/role) for this action.
The requested resource does not exist.
The request could not be completed because it conflicts with the current state of the resource (e.g., attempting to create a duplicate unique resource).
A generic error indicating an unexpected condition was encountered on the server. Should be reported to the development team.

example_error_response.message: The 'email' field is required and must be a valid format.
